peopleAlsoAsk.question: When did they stop making metal Tonka trucks?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The all-metal "Tonka trucks" were sold throughout the world and earned a reputation as being indestructible, although the steel has been increasingly replaced by plastic from the late 1980s onwards. The company was purchased by Hasbro in 1991.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Tonka Construction Trucks - Tonka Wiki - Fandom

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What is the oldest Tonka toy?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Recognizing its potential, they acquired the rights made modifications, and the first Tonka toy – the Steam Shovel – was born in 1947. With its rugged design and realistic features, this toy was an instant hit, setting the stage for a series of iconic toys that would follow.
